second.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the second person, thing, event etc is the one that comes after the first
second.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the second half of the year
the second time in three days
second.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the position in a competition or scale that comes after the one that is the best, most successful etc
second.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: They climbed to second place in the League.
The euro will have a circulation second only to that of the dollar.
second.translation[0].definitions[2].def: another example of the same thing, or another in addition to the one you have
second.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We advertised for a second guitarist.
There was a second reason for his dismissal.
I asked the doctor for a second opinion (=when you ask another person to repeat an examination, test etc for you).
second.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 seconds in a minute
second.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Hold your breath for six seconds.
Ultrasonic waves travel at around 300 metres per second.
second.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a very short period of time
second.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: I’ll be back in a second.
Just a second (=wait a moment), I’ll come and help.
At least 30 shots were fired in a matter of seconds (=in a very short time).
second.translation[1].definitions[2].def: one of the 60 parts into which a minute of an angle is divided. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 78° 52′ 11″ means 78 degrees 52 minutes 11 seconds.
second.translation[1].definitions[3].def: someone who helps someone in a fight, especially in boxing or, in the past, a duel
second.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Tea is the most popular drink, while coffee ranks second  (=it is the second most popular drink).
I came second in the UK championships.
second.translation[2].definitions[1].def: used before you add information to what you have already said
second.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to formally support a suggestion made by another person in a meeting
second.translation[4].definitions[0].def: to send someone to do someone else’s job for a short time
second.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: Jill’s been seconded to the marketing department while Dave’s away.
second.translation[5].definitions[0].def: the second half, quarter etc of the financial year
second.translation[5].definitions[0].exa: The company expects second-quarter sales to be substantially below those of the equivalent period a year ago.
second.translation[6].definitions[0].def: to officially support a suggestion, idea etc made by another person at a formal meeting so that it can be discussed or voted on
second.translation[6].definitions[0].exa: Each nomination must be proposed and seconded by two members of the committee.
second.translation[7].definitions[0].def: to arrange for an employee to work for another organization for a period of time
second.translation[7].definitions[0].exa: We provide the opportunity for you to be seconded to industry to receive additional in-service training.
